title.value: Image-Guided Brachytherapy for Rectal Cancer: Reviewing the Past Two Decades of Clinical Investigation
title.justification: The title is clearly stated at the beginning and throughout the document in headings and citations.
title.quote: Image-Guided Brachytherapy for Rectal Cancer: Reviewing the Past Two Decades of Clinical Investigation

extractions.description: The paper reviews two decades of clinical investigation on the use of image-guided brachytherapy for rectal cancer, focusing on technological advancements and clinical studies validating this treatment modality.

type.justification: The paper discusses clinical studies, trials, and empirical results regarding image-guided brachytherapy for rectal cancer.
type.quote: This manuscript summarizes two decades of technological evolution and progress in clinical studies to validate this treatment concept...

name.justification: The research focuses on treatments for rectal cancer, which falls within the oncology field.
name.quote: With the introduction of better-quality imaging for tumor visualization and treatment planning, a new conformed radiation treatment was introduced with high-dose-rate endorectal brachytherapy (HDREBT).

name.justification: The paper primarily discusses radiation therapy techniques for rectal cancer.
name.quote: HDREBT is a conformed radiation therapy that is safe and effective, and is presently explored in a phase III dose-escalation study in the NOM of patients with operable rectal cancer.
